intro: Rumfordia polymnoides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, oval fruits. Rumfordia polymnoides is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
